Unusual volume of network traffic or con.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek dns.log
Unusual volume of network traffic or con.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections and data transfer volume to IPs/domains of major cloud storage providers. Use Zeek dns.log to identify cloud storage domains being resolved internally. Calculate baseline traffic volume using time series analysis for specific internal hosts/segments. Alert on statistically significant deviations (e.g., using standard deviation or IQR) from typical upload/download patterns from unexpected sources.

Anomalous authentication attempts or ses.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for connections from internal hosts to known IP ranges or domains associated with cloud service APIs/management interfaces. Use Zeek dns.log to track lookups for these services. Identify source hosts/users exhibiting connection patterns inconsistent with their role (e.g., using correlation analysis to find unusual co-occurrence of internal host activity and cloud management connections). Look for unusual ports or protocols used for access.
